docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, July 29 -- President Edelmiro Farrell and War Minister Juan Peron reaffirmed Argentina's determination to defend her "dignity, honor and rights" in brief addresses they delivered this afternoon to a large meeting organized by labor...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, July 29 -- President Edelmiro Farrell and War Minister Juan Peron reaffirmed Argentina's determination to defend her "dignity, honor and rights" in brief addresses they delivered this afternoon to a large meeting organized by labor unions in front of the Foreign Ministry.
docs.abstract: Farrell and Peron s, workers rally; 3 newspapers assailed; Brazil backs US stand; Uruguay mediation possible

headline.main: ARGENTINA STAGES NATIONALIST RALLY; Farrell and Peron Address Workers -- Brazilians Take Stand With U.S.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 3 -- A request that a former Argentine Deputy and a veteran Socialist leader, Dr. Nicolas Repetto, should be indicted for high treason on grounds that he had "compromised the peace and dignity of the Argentine nation" has been...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 3 -- A request that a former Argentine Deputy and a veteran Socialist leader, Dr. Nicolas Repetto, should be indicted for high treason on grounds that he had "compromised the peace and dignity of the Argentine nation" has been presented to the Federal public prosecutor in Buenos Aires.

byline.original: By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 23 -- The freeing of Paris, although expected almost hourly for the past two days, caused a wave of the deepest emotion to spread over Argentina, whose people have always been very responsive to French cultural influences.

headline.main: ARGENTINES CHEER PARIS LIBERATION; Police Fail to Halt Speeches -- Uruguay, Mexico and Cuba Celebrate

byline.original: By Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: One hundred and nineteen years ago a little band of men known as the "Triente y Tres" (the "Thirty and Three") met secretly in the city of Florida in what was then the southernmost territory of the Empire of Brazil to issue a declaration of defiance...
docs.lead_paragraph: One hundred and nineteen years ago a little band of men known as the "Triente y Tres" (the "Thirty and Three") met secretly in the city of Florida in what was then the southernmost territory of the Empire of Brazil to issue a declaration of defiance to the Portuguese rulers of the Bande Oriental and an affirmation of the independence of South America's smallest nation.

docs.snippet: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 29 -- Acting on what labor circles here said was confidential information received from various Latin-American countries, Vicente Lombardo Toledano, president of the Confederation of Workers of Latin America, today issued a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY, Aug. 29 -- Acting on what labor circles here said was confidential information received from various Latin-American countries, Vicente Lombardo Toledano, president of the Confederation of Workers of Latin America, today issued a statement in which he accused Argentina of fostering the setting up of Fascist governments in the Western Hemisphere.
docs.abstract: V Lombardo Toledano accuses Argentina of attempt to set up Fascist govts in S Amer countries; charge denied

headline.main: ARGENTINA IS ACCUSED OF WIDE FASCIST PLOT

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 2 -- In a speech to the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange on Aug. 25, whose full text was published today, Vice President Juan Peron, in his capacity as Minister of Labor and Social Welfare, urged the controllers of Argentile capital to...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 2 -- In a speech to the Buenos Aires Stock Exchange on Aug. 25, whose full text was published today, Vice President Juan Peron, in his capacity as Minister of Labor and Social Welfare, urged the controllers of Argentile capital to support the Government's program of social reform, which he summed up in the words "social justice."
docs.abstract: Argentine Vice Pres Peron sees Communist peril

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (AP) -- Proposals for setting up air service to the West Indies, Central and South America and across the Atlantic to Northern and Central Europe, Russia and points in Asia are made in applications filed with the Civil Aeronautics...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 3 (AP) -- Proposals for setting up air service to the West Indies, Central and South America and across the Atlantic to Northern and Central Europe, Russia and points in Asia are made in applications filed with the Civil Aeronautics Board by the Moore-McCormack Steamship Lines.
docs.abstract: sought by Moore-McCormack SS Lines, NY to West Indies, Central Amer, S Amer and transatlantic to Eur and Asia

docs.snippet: The Canadian free dollar moved lower last week, selling down to 89.62 cents, on Wednesday, from an opening price on Monday around 90.06 cents. Amounts involved were small, dealers said, attributing the easier tone more to the lack of business than to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Canadian free dollar moved lower last week, selling down to 89.62 cents, on Wednesday, from an opening price on Monday around 90.06 cents. Amounts involved were small, dealers said, attributing the easier tone more to the lack of business than to any particular incident in the financial picture. There was a modest upturn at the week's close to 89.75 cents, a loss of 5/16 cent from the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED SEPT. 2, 1944

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 9 -- The Foreign Ministry announced tonight that Argentina had decided to withdraw from the Emergency Advisory Committee for the Political Defense of the Continent, which has been sitting in Montevideo, Uruguay, under the...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Sept. 9 -- The Foreign Ministry announced tonight that Argentina had decided to withdraw from the Emergency Advisory Committee for the Political Defense of the Continent, which has been sitting in Montevideo, Uruguay, under the chairmanship of Alberto Guani, former Uruguayan Foreign Minister, since April, 1942.
docs.abstract: Foreign Ministry announces decision to withdraw from Emergency Advisory Com for Pol Defense of Hemisphere because of com stand; Prensa criticizes Hull recent statements; Cabildo assails Hull

docs.snippet: Women of all ages in many Latin-American countries are "psychologically" in the war and are extremely interested in international post-war problems, as indicated at numerous women's meetings held recently in Chile, Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina, it...
docs.lead_paragraph: Women of all ages in many Latin-American countries are "psychologically" in the war and are extremely interested in international post-war problems, as indicated at numerous women's meetings held recently in Chile, Brazil, Uruguay and Argentina, it was reported yesterday by Miss Margaret E. Forsyth, new director of the foreign division of the Young Women's Christian Association, who returned Thursday from several months' tour of these nations.
docs.abstract: M E Forsyth on Latin-Amer women's interest in war and post-war problems
